We did not eat at any of the restaurants on site, but there was a restaurant and bar located at the hotel, as well as a spa that we did not use. For the price the hotel was what we expected. We spent most of the day away from the hotel touring the area. If you are looking for a romantic getaway, I would probably not stay here and would look into one of the area bed and breakfast. We did use the pool one afternoon and there were many children at the hotel. We enjoyed the Napa Valley. We were there over Labor Day weekend. It was a busy weekend in the area, but not overly crowded. We especially enjoyed the wine and cheese tour at the Robert Mondavi Winery and St. Francis Winery in Sonoma is also a great place to stop. The food at Don Bistro Giovanni was good, but the service was fair at best. I would highly recommend a visit to this area. It was an easy drive from San Francisco. The Marriott will meet all of your needs. It is an economical hotel, and a good choice especially if you are going to spend a lot of time touring the area. We finished our trip with a couple of days in Half Moon Bay, which was a relaxing ending to the week.

Reviews.Title: “Great Home Base for Visiting the Napa Area”
Reviews.Author: snowmaninsnowcountry
Reviews.Content: I flew into San Fransisco and headed up in the rush hour traffic and arrived after dark. I stayed at this property for an area business meeting for several days. I must say that the lighting around the front of the complex and parking areas could be improved. The staff was very friendly and accommadating when you needed anything or information. In my opinion the beds were great and some of the best covers and padding I have seen in a long time, compared to other motel chains. The pictures posted by others give you a good idea what is present. Great flat screen tv to relax and unwind if you choose, other then hitting the streets. I do reacall They did have the nightly wine tasting from around 5:30-7:30 I believe when I was there. You do have great access to the area highways for travel up towards the vineyards of the Napa area. There is also a varety of dinning in the area, so one should be able to find what ever they are looking for. If your into organic foods and items, there is a whole foods market down the street that opened in January. Expect to spend a lot as this is an expensive area to visit and dine around. Overall I would stay here again if I would visit this area for business or pleasure, as there is a variety of things to do in Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “It's Napa, not "Napa"”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrierMD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a last-minute meeting in Napa Valley. It is a perfectly serviceable Marriott hotel, with a convenient location at the south end of Napa Valley, just off Route 29. The hotel is fairly ordinary, typically suburban Marriott style. I did not use the Spa. If all you are looking for is a home base for sightseeing, or for business in Napa, then it's fine. If, on the other hand, you want some special "Napa" ambiance or sense of being somewhere other than a chain hotel, look elswhere.

Reviews.Title: “I agree with the last guy”
Reviews.Author: Clarkvara
Reviews.Content: Exactly. An average hotel but in a location that demands a higher price. I guess I booked the concierge level room but it appeared that half the hotel is this class of room or people were just crashing the concierge room/services. I prefer a hotel that is right in the thick of things and didn't realize it was about a 20 minute ride south of all the good wineries in Rutherford/St Helena/Calistoga. You can likely get a decent B&B right in the thick of things for a similar price with more attentive service.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel with nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: minuit999
Reviews.Content: *We booked this place the prior night on priceline for $140, so bear in mind this review is written through the lens of getting a good deal at the last minute.* Background: Couple in their late 20's/early 30's from SF looking to do a spontaneous overnight trip to Napa. The Marriott has a modest appearance but serves its purpose of providing a relaxing getaway for a few days. It has a gym, pool, hottub, and spa - so you have plenty of amenties. I was impressed that the rooms had flatscreen tv's. In the evening, there is a complimentary wine and cheese spread from 5:30-6:30 I believe. We were greeted by very friendly staff who put us up in a King bed on the second floor. Also went out of their way to look up my rewards number after I checked in and actually called my room to confirm they'd been successful in finding it. The room itself is nice - great bed, large, very clean. The pool area is large (85 person capacity) , clean, and well kept. Plenty of kids running around and making new friends with other people's kids, which was very cute. They also serve you food poolside. Towels and beach chairs are available for lounging and again, very clean. Location-wise, it's about a 10 minute drive to the main winery strip. Overall, I may or may not stay here again (we may want to try a more luxurious hotel) but it's great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dothedew
Reviews.Content: This hotel was average at best. It is considered a higher class Marriott only because of it's location in Napa, but I've stayed at other Marriotts which were way nicer. I asked for an early check-in and when I arrived at 1pm my room was not ready. The front desk took my number, but never called when the room was ready. Finally at 3pm I came back and it was ready, but still no one had called. The room itself was ok, but there was a large bush blocking the window so there was no view. The pool was nice and the jacuzzi was great. If I had not gotten the room for free by using my points I would not have stayed there. I would recommend staying somewhere a little more north too, since a lot of the wineries are higher in Napa. A few places not to miss are the Robert Mondavi tour, The Hess winery & art gallery, Tra Vigne for dinner, and Hurley's for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott in Napa was a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: alisononthego
Reviews.Content: The Marriott was a nice hotel. Our room was large and the amenities were very nice, great linens and bed. It was an easy location for wineries. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We booked a standard room and were upgraded to a concierge room which was really great. I would pay for that room category if I go again. It included a lounge stocked with sodas and bottled water all day, but it had a large buffet for breakfast, a wine and appetizer spread in the afternoon and a dessert set up in the evening - saved us a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Visit at the Napa Marriott”
Reviews.Author: vickizig
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our stay at the Napa Marriott. It's a very nice property. As others have noted, it does not have the exterior appearance of a new Marriott (2 level spread out in a rectangle over large block), but the room decor and accommodations are definitely up-to-snuff at the Marriott level. Has a very nice pool with attractive landscaping in the large center courtyard. The staff is friendly. We checked in at the evening wine tasting time, and Blossom, the extremely pleasant evening manager, serving double-duty as bartender, was more than happy to share numerous winery and dinner recommendations that were helpful during our stay. We booked our room about a week in advance for a mid-June, mid-week stay through Priceline at $155.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoJanson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our stay at the Marriott for a couple of reasons. We wanted a decent hotel, in a decent location. The results were exactly what we expected. We wanted to spend our vacation money at the wineries, not the hotel. So why spend a lot of money on one of the pricey spas or B & B's? However, we also wanted a clean room with comfortable beds, and Marriott delivered. The location was right off Highway 29, which made getting to and from all the wineries very accessible. My husband and I agreed that we will definitely stay at the Marriott for future vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory but not special”
Reviews.Author: NoLaDawlin
Reviews.Content: We chose the Marriott as our resting place in Napa because I have elite status in their rewards program. It was a disppointing choice. The staff was a bit fickle. We called the hotel at 1PM and confirmed that we would have 2 beds as there were 3 in our party. When we checked in at 6 PM the front desk wanted to give us a room with 1 king size bed. It took quite a while to resolve the situation and the staff was less than accomodating. The hotel itself is very large. The charm and quaintness of being in winecountry are lost there. You have to drive through the parking lot to the corner entrance nearest your room. Bell service was not offered. The rooms are typical for a Marriott/Courtyard. The hotel is satifactory but not special. I will look for someplace a little smaller and more hospitable next time I'm in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HMMC76
Reviews.Content: Staff: Very friendly and helpful with check in and check out. Property: Well kept. Nice landscaping. Didn't have enough lighting when it became dark. There were separate entrances to the building and you had to use your room key to get in. Didn't get to use the pool, the spa or the fitness room. Rooms: Nice and clean. Comfy bed. Standard room. A little hard to get to since my room was located on the back of the property. Wi-Fi - was told by a friend that it was a $10/night charge but didn't check into it. Bathroom: Clean with plenty of towels. They have aromatherapy lotion, shampoo and conditioners. Smelled wonderful. Hotel restaurant: Harvest Cafe. Went there for breakfast only. Usual breakfast items like bacon, sausage, omelette station, toast, some pastries, eggs benedict, cereal, fruit and yogurt. Nothing special. The host I had was not rude but you can tell she was a little annoyed when I asked to be seated with friends (4 person table with 4 people already on it). Didn't bother me. Proximity: Pretty close to most wineries and shops. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn, with Marriot level staff and Marriott Beds”
Reviews.Author: dlist25
Reviews.Content: Ok, So Marriott definitely purchased this property and remodeled it. It is not in your typical location, nor are the rooms of Marriott quality, I really felt like i was in a Holiday Inn, with the wonderful Marriott Bed and Pillows. The staff was very helpful and attentive. I have no complaints other than the place really scared us. Other reviews state the location was very good. It is right off of 29, but is not at the edge of town, which the town of Napa was not all that impressive anyways. this hotel is close to some vineyards.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location if you have a car.”
Reviews.Author: Dakota20
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in this hotel and really liked it. It is on the outskirts of Napa downtown but a great location if you have a car as you can go north into the valley or south to Pinot vineyards. The rooms were Marriott standard (nice), the staff was helpful and there was a free wine tasting each night. If you are Concierge level the lounge had a nice continental breakfast. We flew into San Francisco rented a car and drove to the Hotel. It took about an hour and was easy to find. We didn't spend much time in the hotel but my wife used the whirlpool and enjoyed it. There is a spa adjacent to the hotel that looked nice but we didn't use it.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: Hygienist83
Reviews.Content: We were at the Napa Valley Marirott for a weekend. We stayed on the club level.Breakfast was great, the biggest strawberries I've ever seen. Rooms were very nice and comfortable. Staff's knowledge of wineries and restaurants was excellent. They helped us plan which ones to visit, we did little research before heading to Napa(my husband was on businees in SanFransico). Del Dotto and Castilla de Amarosa were the highlights of our weekend. Did not have time to visit spa though. We would stay at this hotel again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Napa Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: WeekendWarriors10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room at the Marriott on our weekend get away to beautiful Napa Valley. Let me start off by saying it was in a great location! Although it wasnâ€™t actually out in the countryside, it was right at the edge of town, which made for an easy escape to the wineries. The hotel is right around the corner from a Whole Foods which allowed for us to pack an amazing picnic lunch for our wine tasting. We arrived at the Marriott just in time to enjoy the complimentary wine and cheese tasting. It was a great time to explore the hotel and get a recommendation for a place to have dinner. The front desk was very helpful and sent us to an excellent restaurant near by called Fume Bistro. They also supplied us with maps of the wineries so we were able to navigate throughout Napa. The rooms were nice and up to Marriott standards. We would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MirandaTravel
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wine tasting tour and spa getaway in Napa. Our room at the Marriot was large and the beds were very comfortable. Normally we stay in Calistoga for the spas but found that the spa at the Marriot was just as good minus the natural mineral baths. Rooms in other areas of the wine country are much fancier but of course pricier. This hotel is great for a quick getaway or families looking to experience Napa without breaking the bank. I loved the wine and cheese reception every evening and the convenient location of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value But Older Property!”
Reviews.Author: Goneagain
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled to book this hotel at the last minute for a bargain price! So we certainly got our money's worth and had a good stay. However, as mentioned before, this is an older property and in need of re-decorating. The photos on this site are accurate but the mismash of fabrics, carpeting and wallpaper seemed more glaring in person. The bed and linens were very comfortable and our room was nice and quiet! Housekeeping responded quickly to a problem we had with the plumbing. We would choose this hotel again for the location and price but would not be willing to pay top dollar. We enjoyed a lovely dinner at Bistro Don Giovanni which is nearby and we look forward to a return visit!

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: cherbonsy
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at the Napa Valley Marriott Hotel & Spa for two days over New Years. While the room itself was comfortable enough, though surprisingly sparse for what Marriott considers a 4-star, Category 6 (30,000 point / night) property. Almost certainly what elevates the property to a Category 6 is it's proximity to Napa wineries, not the amenities or the 20+ year old property. The main amenity seemed to be a wine reception hour from 5:30p - 6:30p nightly. A great idea for wine country, but after a day of tasting the valley's finest offerings, returning to a cousin of Two Buck Chuck is less appealing. We also toured, but didn't make use of, the spa: a building adjacent to the hotel that sells day passes for $25 in addition to their a la carte services. The hotel provides no free wireless (or wired) access to the internet, instead charging $9.99 per 24 hour period. Local calls are $1 for 20 minutes talk time; 10 cents per minute thereafter. To me, all this seems inane for a place that promotes itself as "unrivaled." In the end, while we were satisfied enough with the stay itself, it did not meet our expectations. We later stayed at the brand new 2-star, Category 4 Fairfield Inn & Suites Napa American Canyon (some 11 miles further south) and can report it to be a better value, more comfortable, and with better amenities included.

Reviews.Title: “Thought it was great”
Reviews.Author: JasonSam
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two days over New Year's and enjoyed our stay. The hotel is not located in a very scenic area but it is a great starting off point and close to COPIA as well as Mondavi Winery. The staff was excellent and printed off a list of what was open on New Year's day and eve as well as things to do on New Year's Eve. The room was nothing special but was clean and spacious. The spa is nothing special and the workout room was very nice. We only ate the cold buffett in the mornings but thought it was well priced and filling. I would not hesitant to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Luxury w/Kids at Napa Valley Marriott”
Reviews.Author: familytravellerSf
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Hotel and Spa in Napa is exceptionally well located as a jumping off spot for Napa/Sonoma Valley travels. Located just off the highway, it is close to downtown Napa but offers the convenience of a gas station, Trader Joe's, a Target and other shopping within walking distance. Traveling with two kids, it saved me the grief of trying to find stores when my toddler decided all he wanted to eat was vanilla yogurt and apple juice or when I realized I didn't bring a toddler toothbrush. Aside from its geographic location, my stay at the Marriott got off to a good start when we walked into the large and attractive reception area, complete with fireplace and comfy seating area. The front desk staff was also very friendly and accommodating by offering a crib and rollaway bed for our room. Both of which were in the room when we settled in 5 mins. later. Our room was a located in the concierge wing of the hotel and was tastefully decorated. The room was ample, very clean and boasted a large flat panel TV with easy on demand pay-per-view features. The bed was very comfortable and a thermostat on the wall easily controlled the temperature in the room. Our room was above a water fountain which I found relaxing, but may bother some people. Other than that we were not disturbed by outside noises. Our stay was made particularly enjoyable by the special amenities afforded to guests in the concierge wing. In the concierge lounge, we were treated to complimentary breakfast, cheese and wine and dessert. As well as, coffee, tea, water and soft drinks all day long. The lounge was cozy and opened out to a courtyard seating with green space, attractive landscaping and small fountains. My son particularly enjoyed running around this area. I would definitely visit this hotel again and next time I might take advantage of the full menu of spa treatments or the swimming pool, weather permitting.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful fall stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: guer01ita
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a fantastic girlfriend getaway weekend in Napa. The leaves were changing on the grape vines, and the weather was perfect. The Napa Marriott was a great find - and very reasonably priced. There weren't tremendous frills, but the fireplace was nice, and free coffee was provided in the lobby every morning. The location was also great - in between Yountville and downtown Napa. The concierge provided great meal suggestions - Brix and Ristorante Allegria. We also enjoyed fantastic and VERY reasonably priced massages at St. Pierre Center for Massage - ask for either Guadalup or Sean. It was the best massage either of us have ever had! The wineries were fantastic - our personal favorites were Grigich Hills and Peju.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Napa”
Reviews.Author: LGPITT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott in Napa for 2 nights in November and had a great time. No complaints about the hotel at all. Everyone was friendly and helpful; the rooms were clean and spacious; the location was good. Every evening there was a reception with wine and cheese - the spa was also giving free massage demonstrations during this time. The massage was great and we would have definitely booked a full one if we hadn't run out of time. We had tickets to a concert in Petaluma and the concierge helped us with directions and dining options. In Petaluma (which looked a like a really nice town - would have like to have explored more), we had dinner at McNears Saloon which was attached to Mystic Theatre (also McNears) - it was a really nice bar, food and atmosphere were excellent. We took a wine tour with Platypus wine tours and had a great time. I would highly recommend Platypus to anyone who wants to go on a wine tour. After the wine tour, we had dinner at Cole's Chophouse which is another must for anyone who wants a great steak with a nice atmosphere. We loved everything about Napa from our Hotel to the food, wine, etc. and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: napagirl2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in Napa and is a short ride to many of the wineries. It is a great place to stay and alot cheaper than the hotels in Yountville. The staff was nice. The rooms were clean. The beds were very comfortable. It was quiet at night. The lobby is a nice place to spend some time. They have a free wine and cheese tasting nightly. The food in the bar and the Harvest cafe is good. We had an excellent stay and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Will return to this property”
Reviews.Author: knbn
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Prices are reasonable for the area. Clean rooms, attentive staff. We have stayed here twice and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable is Correct”
Reviews.Author: SusaB
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous posting that called this hotel very comfortable. We stayed here for only one night and I felt lucky to find anything on a Saturday night as most hotels were booked due to the popularity of wine country during October. Our room looked out at the next door Hilton Garden Inn (that looks like it could be a fine substitute if things are all booked) and the room was very comfortable and quiet. There were some rooms with patios that faced the pool and courtyard, I am sure those were very nice but they were filled according to desk clerk. My suitcase did not arrive on our flight and when it came in the middle of the night, the hotel desk just left a message (we saw the light blinking and went down to get the errant suitcase); this was a nice touch rather than letting the phone ring at 2:30 AM when the bag arrived. There is a nice Target nearby where I was able to buy some toiletries. We took the Napa Valley Wine Train on Sunday and it is in downtown Napa, not far from this hotel. The pool was pretty and the wine and cheese in the lobby at 5:30-6:30 was a nice touch. All in all, a very comfortable, nice hotel and very convenient to downtown Napa, Yountville, and points north.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: BostonLegal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with friends over Labor Day weekend. We chose this hotel for our Napa trip because we have local friends who live close by. Had we been entirely on our own, we more likely would have selected something smaller and farther up into the valley. For our purposes, this hotel was great. The pool was comfortable and after the hot afternoons that weekend, it was a welcome break. We spent very little time at the hotel as we were quite busy, finding that for the most part all of our destinations were very accessible from the Marriott. A couple of can't-miss places include the Far Niente Winery and Thomas Keller's Bouchon for dinner. Get drinks only at Auberge du Soleil, as the food was WAY overpriced. Bouchon was substantially better and far more reasonably priced. Cafe Don Giovanni is very close to the hotel and was excellent. If you go for lunch, try to eat outside. This Marriott was nothing special but came with a harvest-time premium. But, it served its purpose. If you're not planning on spending much time at your hotel, this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great!”
Reviews.Author: bzmnlocal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose the Marriot because he is a frequent traveler. I reviewed the hotel and found that it may be nice, although for the $299 a night, I was expecting a bit more than your average Marriot. We had stayed for free in the JW Marriot in San Francisco the night before our arrival and it was extremely wonderful, so I was excited. It wasn't nice. Our room was average to say the least, I expected more from the room. The bathroom was just your normal $129 a night Marriot. I had a courtyard view, so that was good, but the ceiling made a lot of noise all night long. We didn't stay in the room during the day, but the noise went on and kept me awake a lot. We were in the concierge level, but didn't really take advantage of it and the one time we decided to use it, we were printing boarding passes and still had to pay $5 and after our entire experience that made me irritated. We walked over the the spa one afternoon to see if we could squeeze in a spa service and we fully disclosed the fact that I had just been getting over a cold. I asked if that would be okay before I scheduled a facial and my husband scheduled a massage. We only did this so we could go in together. So she scheduled the services and we came back at our scheduled time. I went into the spa and got myself ready for my appointment, and my husband disappeared into the mens room. When I was sitting in the waiting room, excited for this, the girl that scheduled me came in and said they wouldn't be able to help me because of my cold. I was upset, but didn't say anything, more almost in tears than anything else. I left, and spent the next hour and a half dwelling while waiting for my husband to come back. He was upset. He asked them when he came out if I was almost done and they explained to him that they couldn't provide services to me. It was upsetting. Overall the exerience wasn't great at the Marriot. I would suggest finding a more personable place to stay. I am sure it is out there, I just don't know which place we should have chosen. This was to celebrate his 40th birthday and we wanted perfection, so I didn't complain while at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bed Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: lv2travelSacramento
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I stayed one night in Napa and chose the Marriott for the location and price. It was the best priced in its category. I've stayed in Napa several times and found the Marriott to be a good alternative to the larger properties. It was really quiet. We had an "inside" room which had a small patio and two double beds that were just heavenly.... firm but with a great pillowtop. The bedding was above normal grade. I slept all night which I rarely do outside of my own home. Carpet was new and clean. The hotel was quiet inside and also set a bit off of Hwy 29 so no noise there. We originally were shown into an "outside" parking lot facing (and to the west) room around 4p.m. The heat radiating into the room was really uncomfortable so we requested a change which was swiftly affectuated. The bell caption came to our first room, carted our luggage to the second room and filled our ice bucket for us. Would go back in a heartbeat. Spending any time in Napa you learn that you aren't in your room much. Also, ate at Brix, outside, at sunset. Fantastic. One of my favorite restaurants anywhere. The Emeritus Pinot Noir is such a deal ($45 in the restaurant and $34 in the wine shop on site). Went great with both lamb and salmon.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel Where Service Shines”
Reviews.Author: Kgiuffre
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well thought out with a convenient location, Great amenities including good size rooms, cozy beds, turn down service, spa quality toiletries, professional and helpful staff, and conciege options. We stayed in the conciege level rooms, it is well worth it. This meant having the use of a well appointed lounge, access to a garden, a warm breakfast, an appetizer option with wine from 5:30 - 7:30 p.m. and desserts from 7:30 - 10:00 p.m. The hotel printed our boarding passes and gave use great restaurant recommendations. We did eat in the Harvest Cafe upon arrival. The experience was not reflective of service we received from the hotel staff. We waited too long and the food was marginal. More importantly the waitress and hostess both seemed bothered by our presence. The only negatives were a very cold pool.

Reviews.Title: “Skip the spa!!”
Reviews.Author: Italophilia
Reviews.Content: I took my sister to this Marriott because I'm on their rewards program and I usually have great luck with them. I also chose it for the spa. I got a pedicure which was great, but on the expensive side (twice as much as my local place). But, it's the mssage that was pitiful. I've been getting massages for over 10 years and this was the worst. My massage therapist was definitely a novice (even with her 3 years experience). Her idea of a deep tissue massage was to put all her weight on my back (with her elbows), and at one point, I couldn't breathe. I was severely embarrassed because my sister is a massage therapist and she had gotten one from the same person I did. Here I was treating my sis (from NY) to a "nice getaway" and her massage was as awful as mine!! The best thing about the trip was that we had access to the Concierge Lounge which had breakfast, snacks and dessert available. No minibar charges for the juices, bottled water, etc.

Reviews.Title: “No nonsense business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bob_from_CT
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during a conference in October 2006. My room was nice, comfortable queen bed, clean bathroom. The conference rooms were also good. It's a large hotel, and not very personal. The hotel has a nice pool area (which I didn't have time to try...) and a decent sports bar with nice, cold beer! (yes, I went to Napa Valley and drank mostly beer...). A good stay, but probably would have selected a different hotel if I were visiting privately.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for majority of wineries”
Reviews.Author: nyladigm
Reviews.Content: I was on a trip to do take care of some wedding things. I decided to stay at the Marriott b/c of its location. It is a fairly large hotel compared to most of the boutiques and B&B's in the area. It's a little farther away from the wineries but not as far as staying in the embassy suites in downtown napa. My room was nice, comfortable bed, nice reading materials (they had a book featuring pictures and descriptions of several of the wineries in the area), clean bathroom. I usually like to take early morning runs when I on vacation and the location of this hotel was great b/c if you exit the main entrance and turn left you're on Rt 29 and there's a trail that runs parallel to the street. Every morning to the West side of the road I saw hot air balloons cruising around - pretty. I didn't have a chance to get to enjoy the spa but I did walk over to check out the products. Looked clean and nice. Upon checking out I was able to print my boarding pass from the business center but I had to pay like $5. I think its worth it - what's $5 anyways. If you like In-N-Out or Jamba Juice there's a strip mall just south of the hotel on the east side of the highway that has both - two of my favorite places on the west coast.

Reviews.Title: “Great if your rate is under 150”
Reviews.Author: SFBayMommy
Reviews.Content: Since i got a 99 dollar rate including breakfast and a spa discount, this was a great deal. But if you're paying more than 150-ish I'm not sure it's worth it. It's really your average everyday marriott. On the plus side, it's right off the highway (but nearly everyplace except the silvereado is near the highway up there). the spa is nice - pretty average for wine country - as is the fitness room and pool. The room is very average - nothing worth mentioning except they don't carry comedy central on their tv's - eek. Food was good, service was good but not memorable overall.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I expected...”
Reviews.Author: LalaLaine
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I along with another couple wanted to stay in a decent hotel without paying the exorbitant prices seen in other hotels since it was Memorial Day weekend. We wanted a clean, comfortable bed, a quiet room, and good service. We expected a chain like Marriott would provide us this and we got exactly what we wanted. The rooms were clean and the bed was large and comfortable. The decor was not spectacular but it was not tacky either. We booked the concierge level room, which gives you access to their lounge where appetizers are served in the evening with wine. We missed this since we were so busy wine tasting. However, they had a tray of fresh baked chocolate chip cookies that were yummy. There is also bottles of water and fruit to snack on throughout the day and evening if needed. A continental breakfast is served also, typical fare of cereal, pastries, oatmeal, scrambled eggs, toast, juices, etc. I enjoyed it outside by the garden near the fountain and it was lovely. The pool was good too, lots of children but they were so cute and well-behaved. It was just nice to lay out and soak up the sun. Overall, this hotel met my expectations and I had a wonderful weekend. Wineries to visit: Trefethen, Merryvale, Miner, and Opus One were our favorites, especially if you love your reds. Avoid V. Sattui on a holiday weekend, absolute madhouse! But go there if it's just a regular day. If the weather is nice, you must go to Auberge du Soleil and sit outside on the terrace and have a drink while enjoying the beautiful views. So romantic and beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: kiwitravelerpdx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napa Marriott over a weekend for the purpose of attending a wedding at the Meadowood Resort. While staying at Meadowood would have been ideal (and, of course, "uber" luxurious, the daily rate of $600+ was rather steep!) The daily rate of $237 at the Marriott seemed like a bargain in comparision to Meadowood and was favorable relative to other properties in the area. For this we were upgraded to a "concierge" room which provided continental breakfast, afternoon wine and appetizers, and evening desserts. Beverages including bottled water, coffee/tea, and various soft drinks were available all day in the concierge lounge. Parking is complimentary for everyone. We found this older property to be delightful. The buildiing is two stories and somewhat spread out. Interiors have obviously been updated and well maintained, and our room was nicely decorated with "traditional" Marriott furnishings including the super-comfortable bed. The bathroom was average in size. For some curious reason, the temperature in the bathroom was almost sauna-like compared to the rest of the room in spite of thermostat adjustments. Not unpleasant--just odd. The Spa and Health Club are in a separate building across the parking lot. The small curvilinear pool is in the center courtyard, and it is possible to swim laps. The fitness facilities are fine. Even though it's not in the heart of Napa Valley, the Marriott is well located especially to the City of Napa and some of the southern valley wineries. For us a visit to COPIA (the American Center of Food and Wine) was obligatory along with dinner at Julia's Kitchen at COPIA. From the Marriott It's also very easy to get to Sonoma since highway 121 is very close. All-in-all I would return to the Marriott without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property!!!”
Reviews.Author: amzgrace
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay through Travelzoo. The package included one night's stay, two winery tours for two guests (these usually run anywhere from $5-$15), buffet breakfast for two, and a discount at the hotel's spa. It was a great deal!!! The front office staff was very friendly. We ended up staying on Easter and the two wineries that were included in the package were closed for the holiday. The staff anticipated this and were able to provide us with two alternative tour passes. We also had friends come up from San Jose and the staff even gave us passes for them! The rooms was very nice- Marriott standards. Bathrooms were updated and very nice as well. Since this property is in Napa, there were very helpful books about the local winery. This was useful for us last minute planners, but do your research on wineries before you come. The Marriott also offered a nightly wine 'reception'- mainly their house wines and some cheese. It's a nice option. I ordered room service that night and I even got a deal on that, because I order the small caesar salad, which is the size of an entree salad and also the chicken fingers from the kid's menu. This was more than plenty. Breakfast in the morning was fantastic. There was your usual array of fruits, cereal, yogurt, as well as bacon, sausage, breakfast potatoes. There was also an action station where the chef cooked made-to-order omelets and fresh Belgium waffles! The only pet peeve I had during my stay is having to pay an additional $10.00 for internet use. Other than that, it was a very pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Bottled Water Scam”
Reviews.Author: putmank4
Reviews.Content: The stay was nice, and I have no complaints about the room, the location, or the available services. They are all up to typical Marriott quality. However, I stayed there with a small group, and each of us were charged $4.50 for the expensive in-room bottled water, and NONE of us even touched the water!!! This is a scam, and you won't even know you've been charged until well after your stay. It took multiple calls to the hotel to resolve the situation. Check your credit card statements carefully after staying here!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a shame; bring your earplugs”
Reviews.Author: m0thily
Reviews.Content: This hotel has so much potential, and it's obvious they tried to make it a nice place to stay. Sadly, the longer we were there, the more we wanted to never come back (unless we brought earplugs). The staff was courteous at check-in. The room itself was gorgeous and well-appointed. The bed was comfy and huge. The bathroom was clean, and the shower was pure perfection! It's rare we're able to find a showerhead that tall (my husband is 6'2", and some hotels have hobbit-size showers), and water pressure that strong. None of it mattered much, because we only got a few hours of sleep. Starting around 7am, we were woken up by slamming doors. This continued for the next few hours... then we realized it wasn't slamming doors, it was just people leaving their rooms. Someone didn't consider this when they built the hotel with heavy doors and paper-thin walls. We were also able to hear every cough and murmur of the people in the next room. And every activity... Don't expect a beautiful location, either. This hotel is right alongside the freeway. And yes, we were able to hear trucks passing from inside our room, too. It was convenient, but not pretty. Stay here if you get a good deal, and if you remember to bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: CATravelingGal
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one night stay at the Napa Valley Marriott located off of Rt. 29/Solano Ave. This hotel in convenient to wineries and attractions in the Napa Valley, Carneros region, and Sonoma Valley/Sonoma Plaza. We checked-in on Saturday morning and were given a King room facing Route 29. We did not hear any road or traffic noise. The lobby has a warm library feel and the Harvest Cafe is right there. Down the hallway is a sports bar that was open late on Saturday evening. It was a fun place to unwind after dinner and watch the NCAA games on the big screens. The King bed was very comfortable and we had plenty of pillows. The room and bathroom were clean and spacious. No signs of mold or bugs. The water pressure in the shower was great. We ate breakfast at the Harvest Cafe Sunday morning as our package included the breakfast buffet for 2 people. The normal cost is $17.95 a person. It was a great buttet with fruit, pastires, eggs/omelets to order, waffles, french toast, cereal, potatoes, sausage/bacon and more. It was delicious and well worth it - we would have gladly paid for it, but it was included in room rate. It was one of the better hotel breakfasts I have had. I was a little leary of staying here after reading some of the previous reviews about car and room theft. We had no problems and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel For Visiting Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: PlanetSeeker
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here two years in a row now and have on the whole enjoyed the experience. The rooms are large and comfortable but it is a typical Marriott. The restaurant is limited by average service and food. On this trip there was a slight drain smell in one corridor but that has not been our previous experience. Front desk staff were efficient and this is the only hotel where requests to remove feather bedding and replace with hypoallergenic has been done before arrival demonstrating some attention to booking notes. The Concierge Lounge for Marriott Gold & above members is well stocked and efficiently run As a base to explore the Napa wine country we found it close enough to suit our needs but apart from that there is little in the vicinity other than Napa Valley Premium Mall. A well run Marriott given the region. Dont go out of your way to stay there but its a good base if your in the region.

Reviews.Title: “I actually like this place now!”
Reviews.Author: Fonzmambo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel yearly for several years attending a conference at this facility. In the past, the rooms were shabby, a little dirty...nothing to write home about, but we stayed there nonetheless because it was the conference site. Well, after not having been there for two years (we skipped the 2006 conference) I must say this place has really come around! The room we stayed in had two queen sized beds that were extremely comfortable and plush. There was a beautiful, large desk as well as two large chairs, a large closet, and a good sized bathroom with tons of counter space. There was also a coffeemaker, all of the typical bathroom toiletries (except these are from Bath and Body Works!), and plenty of towels. The room and bathroom were very clean, no gross mold or dirty grout in the shower area, and the shower itself was roomy and with a large shower head. There are several outdoor entryways to access the hallways (they require the use of your room key for safety), so there was no long walk required from the parking lot getting into the room. Also, plenty of parking available. The main lobby has a roaring fireplace and lots of comfortable chairs and sofas for lounging, and there is a nightly wine tasting with fruit and cheese served-FREE! The only downers to this hotel, in my opinion, is that the restaurant is not that great and a little pricy, the room is cooled/heated by an older space heater that is a little bit noisy, there is a significant fee for internet service, and there aren't a ton of restaurants within walking distance with the exception of a Starbucks and a Mexican restaurant down the road. All in all, the goods far outweigh the bads in this hotel and I actually look forward to staying here next year (for a change)! :)

Reviews.Title: “It was a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: boxsters
Reviews.Content: We booked their Wine, Dine & Spa package for just $99. We got 2 free tastings to wineries, 2 breakfast buffetsin the HarvestCafe as well as 20%off spa services. Nice king size bed that really was heavenly! Room was clean & comfortable - we LOVE the Bath & Body shampoo, conditioner & body lotion in the bathroom! We also got the Concierge Level for the $99 - it was pretty nice! The wine tasting in the hotel is generous, too. Jacuzzi is open all night, as long as users are quiet. That is always a bonus in my book! Hotel fitness center is part of the SPA - very nice equipment! Only one complaint - the Bar & Grill had bad service - bad drinks, bad prawn cocktail (prawns were grilled!! Huh?!!) Better places to eat in Napa - skip this establishment!

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Napa Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Feverpitch
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights on business so I didn't read the reviews before I went. The hotel is not in a location you would consider for a romantic getaway since it's across the street from a strip mall with Target, etc. and is not in the cute part of Napa. However, the room seemed fine at first. Then I realized I was stolen from too, as a previous reviewer noted. I am now down two ipods and a Palm Pilot. I understand that hotels do not have liability for this, but really, I've never had anything stolen from me in over 8 years of traveling for business. I had a strange feeling when I got in my car to leave that I was missing some things but drove away. I called when I was less than an hour away and alerted the hotel of my missing belongings and they tried to tell me maybe I had left it in the restaurant which I never visited. The only conclusion I can draw is they were stolen either during a cleaning or once I called to say they were missing. I will never stay here again and will tell all my friends and coworkers not to as well.

Reviews.Title: “Napa Napa Napa”
Reviews.Author: whiteagles
Reviews.Content: My brother's girlfriend works for Marriott and because of her we decided to check out the Marriott properties while spending a week in the Napa and Sonoma areas. We thought our stay was rather pleasant and the staff rather accomodating. The beds were heaven and when we asked about a roll away and refrigerator, one was promptly brought to our room without question. We had a great rate on the room, and found the free wine tasting an added bonus to our stay. Although we had no problems with the property, I hope that management at this hotel takes note of the other reviews placed on this site. If I had read them before staying at this property, I probably would have booked elsewhere....

Reviews.Title: “OK place to stay for $129/night (off-peak)”
Reviews.Author: Shortz
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly. The room was clean and updated with the the "new" comfy Marriott beds (read: wanna be Westin bed). However, the acoustics were very bad. We could hear other guests' voices, which were at normal decibel levels, from the hallway and next room. We also heard voices coming through the bathroom vents. The heater/ac fan was extremely noisy but it was somewhat helpful in drowning out the other guests' voices! The hotel is right off the freeway, close to downtown Napa. The hotel is not in the "quaint" part of the Napa so expect to see the ubiquitous Starbucks and Target nearby. If you're planning to spend a lot of the time further North (?), e.g. St. Helena, be prepared to drive at least 15-30 minutes to get to your destination. It wasn't a bad deal for $129, but I don't think I'd stay here stay here during the peak season when the rates are $300+.

Reviews.Title: “Travelers Be Warned”
Reviews.Author: TailorMaid
Reviews.Content: Be sure to book elsewhere early so you are not stuck with having to stay at the Napa Valley Marriott. Be especially careful of your valuables, since the staff, especially the housekeeping administrator CONDONES THIEVERY, and because of the non- liability policy, they have no concern or sympathy for their unlucky victims. The older part of the hotel is shabby (missing ceiling tiles, worn carpet) and the hotel in general is not worth the price. However, I can say that the spa is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Better than last visit”
Reviews.Author: TrvlDva
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel for two nights Oct. 30th and 31st, and enjoyed my stay. The hotel has been remodeled since my last stay (three years ago), and has upgraded bedding (very comfortable bed, with down comforter) and decor. The location is perfect, and the service was very good. There are probably a few better hotels in the area, but for the price and the points, I would recommend the Napa Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: ltsjdad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is everything you would expect from a low end Marriott - adequate rooms, noise from the freeway, overpriced resturant, and fair service. The biggest issue I have with this, or any other Marriott, is the execssive rate charged for internet access. $9.95 per DAY for in room and up to $30.00 per HOUR in the business center. The food in the resturant was overpriced and under flavored. $15.99 for a breakfast buffet plus coffee and juice. I am beginning to wonder when Marriott will begin charging for the "complementary" shampoo, conditioner, etc as well as a per towel charge.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Napa Marriott”
Reviews.Author: goldberry
Reviews.Content: I use TripAdvisor reviews on a regular basis when we travel. In the case of something like the Napa Marriott, I was scratching my head because it seems to run such a gamut. Because we like Marriott and this was convenient to the wine country, we decided to risk it. (Hey, you can always go somewhere else, right?) We're so glad we went here. Granted, this is not the most "spiffy" Marriott I've ever seen, especially since we'd just stayed four nights in the lovely downtown SF Marriott. But the Napa property was actually cleaner. How do we know? The allergies don't lie about how much dust is in the room, and they were quiet here. There was a large gap at the bottom of the door that let in a lot of hallway light, but a bath towel took care of that problem. I don't mind folding a towel when the hotel is clean, quiet, and convenient. The bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom was very clean. I've seen some comments that the concierge room was sub-par, but we had a good experience with that. There was a wine and cheese tasting each night from 4-7, then desserts from 7-10, plus continental breakfast. All of the items we sampled were fresh, and we saw them being regularly replenished. For breakfast we sampled the buffet, and it was a good selection at a good price with friendly service. The Harvest Cafe dining room is warm and very unique with its domed brick ceiling. I've seen negative comments about the food, but our breakfast was fine, though the problems may be with lunch and dinner. We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Clod13
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay. The rooms are spacious and newly decorated. The bath is spacious with a wonderful shower. The beds are very comfortable. Reception staff was extremely quick and very friendly. The food and wine at the Harvest Cafe was good and we had an unhurried dinner. The Sportsbar lacks comfort. We loved our 3 nights here!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Lovebeingretired
Reviews.Content: We were so impressed with this hotel. Outstanding service, one of the most comfortable beds we ever slept in, and great food and wine tasting. We stayed in the Concierge wing and would highly recommend it. The location is convenient to downtown Napa (we ate at Chop's Steakhouse one night and it was very good) as well as heading north to the many vineyards (such beautiful scenery). Would also recommend a meal at the Culinary Institute (Greystone). So much wine, so little time.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy, but decent.”
Reviews.Author: Just4law
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel due to a great Priceline deal. I was a little bit hesitant, but decided it couldn't be that bad. On the trip with me was my husband and 9 month old. Overall, the experience was quite good. Upon arrival, we saw that the lobby is pretty standard for a 3 star hotel. We had requested a crib, which was in the room when we got there. The parking was free and right outside our door, which is great when you have so many bags to bring in because of a baby. We weren't expecting too much, since we got such a great rate. I would not want to spend over $200 for the normal rate for this hotel however. It is a standard 3 star hotel, very clean, great bath amenities. It did the job for us and we were quite happy. I would definitely return provided we get another discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the service”
Reviews.Author: jaloti
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel on my anniversery and when I was checking in they informed us that I didnt have a resvervation on a Saturday night. After the staff researched they found out that it was my travel agent who had booked us at another Marriott in the area. The staff was amazing they were able to get us a beautiful room and called and canceled the original reservation without a charge. The Front desk helped book our Spa treatments at the spa on property which was amazing and the concierge planned out entire stay from which winerys to visit and dinner reservation at Mustards Grill on a Sat night. When we returned from dinner we had champagne and chocalate dipped strawberries in our room with a note from the staff wishing us a happy anniversery. What started out bad turned into one of the best experiences we have ever had at a hotel. Thanks to the staff and the service they provided.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Bel84No1
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice room at this hotel and the bed was extremely comfortable. We will definitely stay here again and would recommend it to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the in-house restaurant, 'Harvest Cafe'”
Reviews.Author: delmar67
Reviews.Content: I gave it 4 stars based on the very nice accomodations, but the food was horrible. We only ate there on our first night since we got in late. Lucky us..they just updated the menu after 2yrs and it was the first night. Wish they had kept the old as at least they probably knew what they were doing. If you must eat/drink in-house stick with the cheaper bar & grill restaurant, "Characters".

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Napa Marriot”
Reviews.Author: michmouse
Reviews.Content: After reading the past reviews, I have decided that all the complaining about construction must have resulted in an entirely new Marriot resort :) We found the Marriot hotel in Napa to be the perfect respite after hiking, biking and rafting at Yosemite National Park. This hotel is beautiful and immaculate. The beds were luxurious with mountains of pillows and beautiful bedding...The pool area was very nice, with lovely gardens surrounding it. We also had room service for dinner, and found the food to be excellent, and the service outstanding. The spa offers massages and other treatments, perfect for weary hikers. or anyone who wants to indulge. The employees were helpful and the concegiere made reservations for us at wonderful restaurants throughout our stay. I guess all that construction will ultimately now better serve guests at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Glorified Motel 6!”
Reviews.Author: Fysty01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night on a business trip and I was so glad it was only for one night! It truly is a glorified Motel 6. It's more of a motor lodge than Marriott Hotel. It's a two-story facility with parking all the way around it, just like a motor lodge. The rooms are old and outdated, with the popcorn ceiling and a smelly ventilation unit. The card access door was propped open allowing anyone to access the hotel, which didn't make me feel very safe at all. The hotel staff ran large carts of laundry and towels down the sidewalk outside my window all night long, which woke me up. As far as construction, I experienced the construction noise as well, which was not disclosed to me when I booked the room. Had I known that half of the parking lot would be blocked off and there would be early construction noise, I would have stayed elsewhere. There are much nicer hotels - pay a little more and stay somewhere nice.

Reviews.Title: “Be cautious!”
Reviews.Author: mikichan
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel twice in 2005. On both occasions the Marriott reservation agents made huge errors in my reservations; or perhaps the hotel management didn't do a good job in executing the reservations the way they were made? Who knows... The first time, I specifically requested a garden room (not looking towards the huge parking lot); my girlfriend has allergies and I experienced mild asthma problems then... I asked for a second floor room, to make sure I stay away from any pollution. Also, we asked for a King, or Queen size bed in the worst case... The reservation personnel promised all that in a very servile polite manner. But, upon arrival, we were given a room on 1st floor, looking directly at the parking lot! The room had the heavy overwhelming aroma of old carpet, and the window was not of the open-able type... the only way to get some of the world-famous Napa Valley pure air was to switch the AC / Ventilation System mounted underneath the window. That system was noisy and had a heavy musty smell, just like the carpet. Also, the external vent that picked up air was at the same level as the exhausts of all gas-guzzling SUVs and Monster Trucks that passed by the window with ferocious roar (like Elephant fart) & parked right outside; so generous amounts of fumes entered inside without any problem. In addition, we didn't even get a Queen size... instead, we had to share one of the tiny double bed all night. At least we were into the slightly newer wing of the hotel (for premier Gold members such as myself), the other wing seemed older and more worn out. The second time around, similar thing happened with our reservation. I got a bit mad & had a talk with the hotel manager. As a premier member, they made an "exception": they finally put me into a garden room with queen size bed. Good! However, no room was available in the newer Gold Rewards wing, so they gave me a "nicer" room in the older wing. Oh MG! Never seen a nastier, stuffier room in my life.. What a disgrace. The room's smell was like a mixture of a male goat, rotten Camembert cheese and 2-years old sneakers. In addition, the room was supposed to be non-smoking, but somehow beneath the musty smell I felt there was also a hint of cigarette, too. I'm allergic to ciggie smells, that is why I can easily detect them... Since we were on 1st floor again, we could not leave the French Window open (afraid that somebody can easily enter during the night and surprise in our PJ's...) so again we were forced to use the ventilation. That only enhanced & enriched the stench, instead of alleviating it. For 2 days of stay, my asthma symptoms worsened and started to really bother me again. I guess we are very strong people, it takes A LOT to make us understand, but we FINALLY got the message! We'll just never visit that property again. We are not sure how is Marriott able to sustain such a mediocre property in such a beautiful high-end area, and charge $200 to 400 dollars per night, for rooms that seriously endanger your pulmonary (and mental) health...

Reviews.Title: “Neutral”
Reviews.Author: Nextstoptravel
Reviews.Content: My company was sending me to California for the week so I decided to go early and take my mother to Napa. We booked one night at the Marriot through the hotel itself and the other at the Marriott through Hotwire.com (oddly enough, that ended up being the way to get the best pricing). The location of the hotel is very convenient, and on an overall scale the hotel is very typical of a Marriott (just about what you would expect in terms of cleanliness, comfort, etc.) However, here are a few issues that we encountered in our stay: - The in-room internet did not work (they sent an engineer in to fix the problem, and then the problem kept coming back). - The door was so badly hung that there was a 1/2 inch gap in the bottom of the door up to the door handle and you could see into the room from the hallway. We ended up having to hang a towel over the door whenever we were in the room. - There was construction going on at the hotel that we were unaware of when we booked our stay. The management insisted that the construction was 'minor' and we shouldn't worry about noise (Tell that to the concrete truck and bulldozer outside our window at 8am...). - We were woken up by both the construction noise outside our window, as well as the construction workers extremely loud foul language. - When we went outside to escape the construction noises and foul language, we were shocked to find our car (that we had parked in a full lot the night before) gone! According to the construction workers at the site, "well, I guess it coulda got towed" comments, we began to panic and look for our now missing rental car. Walking through the entire parking lot provided NO CAR. After finding the hotel manager we were informed that there was an 'oversight' and we were supposed to get a letter in our room informing us that due to the construction they MIGHT have to tow cars, but that they had failed to get us the letter. A massive search then ensued for our car. At this point, my very traumatized mother is in tears and panicking that our belongings in the car are gone (not to mention having to hike around the hot parking lot in a search for the car). The car was eventually found in an adjacent lot. While the hotel manager was very apologetic (and 'comped' one night), this situation RUINED our stay at the Marriot, in addition to costing us time on our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: OCAlan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Marriott for 3 days and found it to be just what we needed. It was located in a very ideal location, near highway 29 in northern Napa. We did not hear the highway like others and found the accomadations to be great. The rooms were clean and rather large, and the bathrooms were spacious with great water pressure. Not knowing too much about the area the concierge was very helpful in letting us know some great wineries to visit and more importantly, the bests places to eat for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. When the concierge was not in, the hotel staff was more than happy to give us their local knowledge of the area. Didn't get to try the spa next door, which we regretted, but I think we were already pretty relaxed after a day filled with wine tastings. Overall a great place to stay and would definitely stay here agin.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more...”
Reviews.Author: adbewillis
Reviews.Content: My husband, our four kids and myself stayed at the Napa Marriott and were very pleased. After reading some of the reviews, I was a little worried, but was pleasantly surprised when we arrived. The hotel was clean and comfortable with great decor. Our room was spacious and had the MOST comfortable beds. The bathroom was super clean and looked like it might have recently been remodeled. The kids took a swim in the heated pool and loved it. We enjoyed the jacuzzi well into the evening! In the evenings, there is a free wine tasting in the lobby that was a great treat! There just wasn't a thing to complain about! We would definitely stay again if we have the opportunity!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Nice spa!”
Reviews.Author: anamacbrat
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Napa Valley Marriott for one night (2/17/06) for a birthday celebration! Got a terrific rate of $99 with free breakfast for two from TravelZoo. Easy to find right off Hwy 29. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable with two wonderful queen size beds with pillow-top mattress pads! The bathroom was up-to-date with marble floors and granite countertops and the ammenities were from the Bath & Body Works Aromatherapy line. The lobby was spacious with comfortable chairs and fireplace. Adjacent to the lobby are two restuarants that serve breakfast, lunch and dinner. We spent the day at the Amadeus Spa which is actually next door (you must leave the hotel and walk across the parking lot to get to the spa)... highly recommend the spa, although pricey! We had a terrific "spa mini-vacation", fun to go to with your girlfriends!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant home base”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Napa Valley Marriott for two nights while visiting the wine country and we were pleased with our stay. In fact, I can't really remember anything negative. The room was nicely appointed, large and comfortable. There was a bottle of wine in the room for purchase instead of the typical bottle of water. A nice touch if you're here for wine tasting and touring. We liked the hotel as a home base for touring. It was much less expensive than staying up the valley. We paid $100/night for a Friday and Saturday, which was great. Our room was in the back of the hotel, which made it quiet. We didn't use the pool or fitness room, nor did we eat at the restaurants. But the front desk staff and guest services people were very nice and pleasant, just the way they should be. I would stay here again and recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: “Freeway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ask for a garden room, or you'll be listening to the freeway. This Marriot used to be a Holiday Inn, and you can tell. The employees are defensive and grumpy; probably because so many people are expecting a "Marriot Napa Resort and Spa" and are continually complaining. Nice/clean...but get a garden room!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at Napa Valley Marriott”
Reviews.Author: laurag007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the Napa Valley Marriott for a long weekend of wine tasting. We chose the Marriott because we wanted to use the points I have accumulated through business travel. We figured we would not be in the room much so we were not looking for anything special - just a nice, clean, quiet place to sleep, which is exactly what this Marriott was. If we had been paying for a room we might have chosen someplace more charming, but we expected this place to be like a Marriott and it was. Some reviewers here have complained that this hotel was a disappointment because Napa Valley is filled with bed and breakfasts that are much more charming. That is certainly true and if you want a place with charm then don't stay here. This Marriott is like any other Marriott except that it is in Napa. It is located well for driving to the wineries of Napa or Sonoma. We were upgraded to concierge service and took advantage of the free continental breakfast. We didn't have problems with road noise as some have reported but we stayed in a first floor room away from highway 29 so we can't comment on whether the front of the hotel is different.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel, ok, Spa, very nice”
Reviews.Author: TeddiBytheBay
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a one night getaway (we live local to the Bay Area) for my husband and myself. Got a good price thru either Priceline or Hotwire (been a while, so can't recall). I paid $90 - 110 range. I would recommend the Embassey Suites over the Marriot, honestly, if you don't plan on hitting the spa. I was disappointed in our room. The hotel was "nice" but honestly, elsewhere for the same price, you'd get better. I've stayed in just as nice rooms (I'm sure we got a 'priceline' room) for much less, similar to a Days Inn. I honestly did expect a bit more. Several others mentioned the shower issues and I recall that happened to us too! Our feather down comforter had a hole in it, and what a MESS that makes if you ruffle it around at all. We ended up just taking it OFF the bed and telling room service about it in the morning, so hopefully they didn't pass it along on the next guests. We ate at one of the onsite restaurants, it was decent, but certainly nothing memorable, but could have gone elsewhere, gotten just as good a meal and paid less. In fact, I'd definately recommend trying out some of the local dining options. The spa, which is onsite, but separate from the hotel, was however very pleasant. Had a nice atmosphere. Showers, spa, steam room, tea/coffee came with any service (access all day to the spa). Had a nice relaxing massage. Planning a return trip (to the spa only) this weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: sandyhandz
Reviews.Content: Got last minute deal on Priceline, but also received one of their Priceline special rooms: room next to elevator with bathtub and sink drainage problems. Otherwise, nice big room with nice decor. Granite countertop in bathroom, plush towels. Very noisy, as you could hear everything in the hallway. Good location, right off the 29. No parking problems. We didn't have their brunch, but did walk thru -- looked decent for just under $17. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good room if you can't find something nice in the valley”
Reviews.Author: tdandmd
Reviews.Content: This is a Marriott, so you basically know what you're getting - a clean, decent-sized room with very little charm. We live close by and would prefer to stay in one of the "nice" places further up the valley, but sometimes they're all booked or there's the two-night minimum issue and when you're just staying because you don't want to drive the hour home, this can work. I will say, though, that I am convinced that you get the "bad" rooms when you use Priceline. We were right outside housekeeping's area and we got to listen to them yell up and down the hall all morning.

Reviews.Title: “No Surprises”
Reviews.Author: jptravel
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Marriott and it was exactly as expected. You will find what you would at any Marriott- a clean hotel, helpful staff, decent decor and adequate ammenities. The free breakfast for those in designated conceirge rooms is a nice touch. The hotel is a bit removed from town, but no more than a 3-5 minute drive. If you are looking for the charm of Napa you may want to look elsewhere, but the rooms and bathrooms were large enough and pleasantly decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but depends on what you need”
Reviews.Author: Phantom03
Reviews.Content: If you need to be pampered and/or are looking for that special Napa charm, this isn't the place to stay. To quote many other reviews, this is a pretty "typical Marriott," which can be a good thing for those who want a familiar, clean and reasonably modern place to stay without all the fluff (like us). We got an obscene, and I mean really good, price on our room for 4 nights so we didn't go in with the same expectations as we would have had paying say $300 a night. What's it worth paying? Easily $150 or less, probably up to $200. After that you can find better for the money (if anything is available). There are some pretty good physical descriptions of the hotel in recent reviews, so I'll gloss over that by saying it's very clean with nice size rooms. We had the same problems with the shower not holding a temperature at any time of day. Parking wasn't an issue, always got a spot near a door. Check in and out were a breeze, no surprises. Can't comment on the Spa or pool or stuff like that, we were there only to literally collapse between full days of wine tasting. The big plus to this hotel is it's location. It is right off Hwy 29, the main highway through the Napa Valley and all it's wineries. There are several crossovers to the Silverado Trail off of 29. The hotel is actually on a road called Solano Ave which is like a sevrice road that parallels 29, giving you yet another driving option. Only a couple miles down Solano is Buffalo's Shipping, where you can send as much wine home as you want regardless of State laws. Two reasonably priced gas stations are a block away as is a Taget store and many other shops/restaurants. I didn't see a better place to use as a "base of operations" for your wine country stay. That's what this is and what you should expect, a decent place to sleep and regroup. Bottom Line: Don't expect luxury or old world charm here, just a clean and modern place to crash and ultra traveling convenience to the whole Napa Valley. Take that approach and I can't see how you could not be happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic experience here!”
Reviews.Author: sarah333
Reviews.Content: I have read the last few reviews and think that this hotel was fantastic! The check in process was simple and our room was good, although it was next to the road but then Marriots are always located close to main roads so that you can find them easier. When we arrived we were delivered a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries as a congratulations token as we were there on our honeymoon - which was such a lovely gesture and none of the other hotels had done anything so personal! The consierge was very nice and recommended a great steak house that was a bit in the sticks but was really worth it and we would never have found it otherwise. The breakfasts were lovely and all the staff were so polite and helpful. The swimming pool area was nice and just what you need after a hard day wine tasting. We also had a couple massage which was absolutely fantastic and the best massage i've ever had! The location is also perfect for trying out the local wineries. Napa was actually one of my favourite places in our tour down the west coast of America!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base location for Napa Wineries”
Reviews.Author: Natalie732
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napa Valley Marriott from 8/30/2005 to 09/05/2005 in Room 2009. We got the room on Priceline for $122/night. (For Priceline, check Napa and 3 star hotels - it'll bring up the Marriott and the Embassy Suites). The hotel was a typical Marriott - sort of reminded me of a Courtyard by Marriott instead. But it was a great base location for touring the Napa wineries. All we were interested in was a place to leave our clothes, take showers and sleep. We were not looking for charm. But the hotel was nice. It's located across the street from a shopping center - Target, Ralph's Supermarket, Longs Drug Store, etc. Since we forgot a few things for the trip, it was convenient to have these stores a few minutes away. The hotel offered bottled water in the room for $4.50 so we ran over to Ralph's and picked up a 12 pack of Poland Spring for $4 instead. We had a few breakfasts at the Harvest Cafe. We opted not to take the breakfast buffet for $14.95 since we were able to get a 2 egg breakfast, breakfast meat, hash browns and toast or English muffin for $9.95. The extra $5 would have gotten us cereal and fruit which we wouldn't have eaten anyway. The last few mornings, we ran out to the Jack In The Box and grabbed breakfast sandwiches, coffee and orange juice for $6/person. There are two coffee places across the street as well that seemed to be pretty popular with the locals but I never went to either one. The Characters Sports Bar was a good place to hang out and grab some pub grub and drinks. We hung out there one afternoon while waiting for our laundry. The guest laundry was $1 per load and $1 for 45 minutes of drying. The detergent and dryer sheets were complimentary from the front desk. Since we were heading out for the second leg of our trip and were all wined out, we decided to lay low and wash clothes. I never noticed any noise from other doors in the hallway - it might have been because we had the TV on or we're just not that sensitive to noise. We also used the stairs a lot since the elevator was really slow. By the time the doors opened, closed and started for the second floor, we were already up the stairs and walking towards our room. The one thing I did notice was that the hallways were really long. It sort of reminded us of The Shining where Danny rides his Big Wheel down the halls! But since our room was 2009, we were closer to the stairs and elevator. Because our stay coincided with Labor Day weekend, the hotel was fully booked. Parking was a bear! If we weren't back to the hotel by 7pm, we had to park on the other side of the building and walk back to our entry door. There are several keycard doors around the building that will let you back into the hotel so you never had to walk to through the lobby. On a side note, we decided to get massages over at the Amadeus Spa. I thought the facilities were nice - plenty of towels, nice robes, plenty of water, free steam and hot tub. The massage therapists were great and adjusted their massages to what we wanted. It was a nice way to detox after a few days of serious wine tasting. The only major problem we had was with the shower in the room. After adjusting the water temperature, after about 3 minutes, the water would get scalding hot and then it would get freezing cold. There was no way to control it. I thought it was because we were taking showers at odd hours (3pm, 5pm and 11pm) but it happened in the morning as well. I believe I had one shower where the water actually stayed the same temperature all the way through. It may have been a fluke but it was really annoying. And the only reason we didn't check out and move was because we had already pre-paid with Priceline. I liked the location of the hotel as well as having the shopping center nearby. There's also a post office up the street - very handy since we shipped clothing home to make room in our suitcases for all the wine we bought! Overall, barring the showers, I'd have to say that I'd go back - it was an excellent base for touring Napa. If you're not looking for quaint and charm, this place will definitely suit your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Motel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Needed a hotel during labor day weekend, so there were not many choices allowing a one night stay. Got this Marriott and figured how bad could a Marriott be? Turns out pretty bad. If your the type that goes to Red Lobster and think its fantastic, stay here, you will love it. For those who want a Napa experience-stay elsewhere! Booked a non-smoking concierge floor room for $300.00. We got a ground floor room (hotel only has two floors ala MOTEL6)that has a great view of the front of the minivan that was lierally two feet from our window. In addition, the room smelled from smoke. When we asked to move to a better room we were told a "garden" view was $10 more. WOW, like I could not afford an additional $10. Reminds me when I buy a hundred dollar bottle of wine at dinner and the waiter tells me meat sauce is $1.00 extra. Pure stupidity. Offering free cheap wine and costco cheese is not my idea of concierge class hotels. I would never stay here again- Other then holiday weekends, there are fifty better places to stay

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and staff courteous. The location is right in Napa so you could drive to all wineries. They had a nice warm outdoor pool and whirlpool and free wine tastings at 5:30 pm I got hotel thru Priceline for $115/night for a Fri and Sat night stay and Internet price by hotel was $249 This is a nice hotel for around $150 in peak times but definitely not worth anymore than that. My only complaints were that the walls are very thin and can hear tv in next room and the room had a very musty odor. They need de-humidifiers in the rooms. Stayed at a Marriott in St. Louis that had these and never had an odor. Ate dinner in Rutherford at the Rutherford Grill and it was wonderful. The ribs are to die for. Also took a ballon ride in Napa and was definitely worth it. We used Balloons above the Valley and our pilot Frank was great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful warm and cozy Marriott in the Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: dreamvac
